qas.question: What is Oklahoma's main climate region?
What natural-disaster-based nickname does Oklahoma's region have?
How many tornadoes hit Oklahoma each year?
What types of severe weather does Oklahoma get?

answers.text: severe thunderstorms, damaging thunderstorm winds, large hail and tornadoes

qas.question: Where does Oklahoma receive hot dry air from?

context: Oklahoma is located in a <a0_0>humid subtropical<a0_0/> region. Oklahoma lies in a transition zone between humid continental climate to the north, semi-arid climate to the west, and humid subtropical climate in the central, south and eastern portions of the state. Most of the state lies in an area known as <a1_0>Tornado Alley<a1_0/> characterized by frequent interaction between cold, dry air from Canada, warm to hot, dry air from <a4_0>Mexico<a4_0/> and the Southwestern U.S., and warm, moist air from the Gulf of Mexico. The interactions between these three contrasting air currents produces severe weather (<a3_0>severe thunderstorms, damaging thunderstorm winds, large hail and tornadoes<a3_0/>) with a frequency virtually unseen anywhere else on planet Earth. An <a2_0>average 62<a2_0/> tornadoes strike the state per year—one of the highest rates in the world.
